summary.text:
Represents a directory on the filesystem.

A
`Directory`
instance can be created for any path, and does not need to exist on the filesystem during creation.
Creates an instance of a directory.
An array of:
`file:///`
string URIs,
`File`
instances,
`Directory`
instances representing an arbitrary location on the file system. The location does not need to exist, or it may already contain a file.
A boolean representing if a directory exists and can be accessed.
A size of the directory in bytes. Null if the directory does not exist, or it cannot be read.
Represents the directory URI. The field is read-only, but it may change as a result of calling some methods such as
`move`
Directory name.
Directory containing the file.
Copies a directory.
Creates a directory that the current uri points to.

content.text: Error if the containing folder doesn't exist, the application has no read access to it or the directory (or a file with the same path) already exists.

summary.text: Deletes a directory. Also deletes all files and directories inside the directory.

content.text: Error if the directory does not exist or cannot be deleted.

summary.text: Retrieves an object containing properties of a directory.

content.text: Error If the application does not have read access to the directory, or if the path does not point to a directory (e.g., it points to a file).
An object with directory metadata (for example, size, creation date, and so on).

summary.text:
Lists the contents of a directory.
Calling this method if the parent directory does not exist will throw an error.

content.text: An array of
`Directory`
and
`File`
instances.

summary.text: Moves a directory. Updates the
`uri`
property that now points to the new location.
A static method that opens a file picker to select a directory.

content.text: android
A
`Directory`
instance. The underlying URI will be a content URI on Android.

summary.text: An optional URI pointing to an initial folder on which the directory picker is opened.
Creates an instance of a file.
An array of:
`file:///`
string URIs,
`File`
instances,
`Directory`
instances representing an arbitrary location on the file system. The location does not need to exist, or it may already contain a directory.
A creation time of the file expressed in milliseconds since epoch. Returns null if the file does not exist, cannot be read or the Android version is earlier than API 26.
A boolean representing if a file exists.
`true`
if the file exists,
`false`

otherwise.
Also,
`false`
if the application does not have read access to the file.
A md5 hash of the file. Null if the file does not exist, or it cannot be read.
A last modification time of the file expressed in milliseconds since epoch. Returns a Null if the file does not exist, or it cannot be read.
A size of the file in bytes. 0 if the file does not exist, or it cannot be read.
A mime type of the file. An empty string if the file does not exist, or it cannot be read.
Represents the file URI. The field is read-only, but it may change as a result of calling some methods such as
`move`
File extension.
File name. Includes the extension.
Directory containing the file.
The **
`arrayBuffer()`

** method of the Blob interface returns a Promise that resolves with the contents of the blob as binary data contained in an ArrayBuffer.

[MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/Blob/arrayBuffer)
Retrieves content of the file as base64.

content.text: A promise that resolves with the contents of the file as a base64 string.

summary.text: Retrieves content of the file as base64.

content.text: The contents of the file as a base64 string.

summary.text: Retrieves byte content of the entire file.

content.text: A promise that resolves with the contents of the file as a Uint8Array.

summary.text: Retrieves byte content of the entire file.

content.text: A promise that resolves with the contents of the file as a Uint8Array.

summary.text: Copies a file.
Creates a file.

content.text: Error if the containing folder doesn't exist, the application has no read access to it or the file (or directory with the same path) already exists.

summary.text: Deletes a file.

content.text: Error if the directory does not exist or cannot be deleted.

summary.text: Retrieves an object containing properties of a file

content.text: Error If the application does not have read access to the file, or if the path does not point to a file (for example, it points to a directory).
An object with file metadata (for example, size, creation date, and so on).

summary.text: Moves a directory. Updates the
`uri`
property that now points to the new location.
Returns A
`FileHandle`
object that can be used to read and write data to the file.

content.text: Error if the file does not exist or cannot be opened.

summary.text: The **
`slice()`
** method of the Blob interface creates and returns a new
`Blob`

object which contains data from a subset of the blob on which it's called.

[MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/Blob/slice)
The **
`stream()`
** method of the Blob interface returns a ReadableStream which upon reading returns the data contained within the
`Blob`

.

[MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/Blob/stream)
Retrieves text from the file.

content.text: A promise that resolves with the contents of the file as string.

summary.text: Retrieves text from the file.

content.text: The contents of the file as string.

summary.text: Writes content to the file.
The content to write into the file.
A static method that downloads a file from the network.

content.text: A promise that resolves to the downloaded file.

summary.text: The URL of the file to download.
The destination directory or file. If a directory is provided, the resulting filename will be determined based on the response headers.
A static method that opens a file picker to select a single file of specified type.

content.text: android
A
`File`
instance.

summary.text: An optional URI pointing to an initial folder on which the file picker is opened.
A mime type that is used to filter out files that can be picked out.
A property that indicates the current byte offset in the file. Calling
`readBytes`
or
`writeBytes`

will read or write a specified amount of bytes starting from this offset. The offset is incremented by the number of bytes read or written.
The offset can be set to any value within the file size. If the offset is set to a value greater than the file size, the next write operation will append data to the end of the file.
Null if the file handle is closed.
A size of the file in bytes or
`null`
if the file handle is closed.
Closes the file handle. This allows the file to be deleted, moved or read by a different process. Subsequent calls to
`readBytes`
or
`writeBytes`
will throw an error.
Reads the specified amount of bytes from the file at the current offset.
The number of bytes to read.
Writes the specified bytes to the file at the current offset.
A
`Uint8Array`
array containing bytes to write.
A property that represents the available space on device's internal storage, represented in bytes.
A property containing the bundle directory – the directory where assets bundled with the application are stored.
A property containing the cache directory – a place to store files that can be deleted by the system when the device runs low on storage.
A property containing the document directory – a place to store files that are safe from being deleted by the system.
A property that represents the total space on device's internal storage, represented in bytes.
Returns the base name of a path.

content.text: A string representing the base name.

summary.text: The path to get the base name from.
An optional file extension.
Returns the directory name of a path.

content.text: A string representing the directory name.

summary.text: The path to get the directory name from.
Returns the extension of a path.

content.text: A string representing the extension.

summary.text: The path to get the extension from.
Returns an object that indicates if the specified path represents a directory.
Checks if a path is absolute.

content.text: `true`
if the path is absolute,
`false`
otherwise.

summary.text: The path to check.
Joins path segments into a single path.

content.text: A string representing the joined path.

summary.text: An array of path segments.
Normalizes a path.

content.text: A string representing the normalized path.

summary.text: The path to normalize.
Parses a path into its components.

content.text: An object containing the parsed path components.

summary.text: The path to parse.
Resolves a relative path to an absolute path.

content.text: A string representing the resolved path.

summary.text: The base path.
The relative path.
Whether to create intermediate directories if they do not exist.

content.text: false

summary.text: Whether to overwrite the file or directory if it exists.

content.text: false

summary.text: A creation time of the directory expressed in milliseconds since epoch. Returns null if the Android version is earlier than API 26.
Indicates whether the directory exists.
A list of file names contained within a directory.
The last modification time of the directory expressed in milliseconds since epoch.
The size of the file in bytes.
A
`file://`
URI pointing to the directory.
A creation time of the file expressed in milliseconds since epoch. Returns null if the Android version is earlier than API 26.
Indicates whether the file exists.
Present if the
`md5`
option was truthy. Contains the MD5 hash of the file.
The last modification time of the file expressed in milliseconds since epoch.
The size of the file in bytes.
A
`file://`
URI pointing to the file. This is the same as the
`fileUri`
input parameter.
Whether to return the MD5 hash of the file.

content.text: false

summary.text: Indicates whether the path exists. Returns true if it exists; false if the path does not exist or if there is no read permission.
Indicates whether the path is a directory. Returns true or false if the path exists; otherwise, returns null.
